biography.bio: Ernst Schröder was born on January 27, 1915 in Wanne-Eickel, Germany. He was an actor and director, known for Stresemann (1957), The Odessa File (1974) and The Counterfeit Traitor (1962). He was married to Gesa Ferck and Inge Thiesfeld. He died on July 26, 1994 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Ernst Schröder

biography.bio: Jo Herbst was born on August 11, 1928 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor and writer, known for Rosemary (1958), Teenage Wolfpack (1956) and We Cellar Children (1960). He was married to Annette Grau. He died on September 18, 1980 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Jo Herbst

biography.bio: A vivacious and very attractive blonde supporting actress and occasional singer, Frieda Elfriede Benkhoff was the equivalent of a German Eve Arden. Even though she rarely commanded a leading role, she was an effervescent, perpetually wisecracking scene stealer, who invariably had the last word, whether as friend of the heroine, gossipy aunt or nosy parker. Fita began her working life as a dental assistant and telephone operator, while training for acting in her own time. She made her first theatrical appearance in "Don Carlos" at Dortmund's Stadttheater in 1925. This was soon followed by comic turns on the larger stages of Berlin and Vienna, after which she was signed by Germany's premier film studio Ufa for a series of short featurettes. Fita was already 34, when she made her breakthrough as a feisty maid in Reinhold Schünzel's off-beat comedy Amphitryon (1935). She established such a popular rapport with the actor Paul Kemp, that she was cast opposite him in further popular outings, including Boccaccio (1936), and, for once co-starring, in The Bashful Casanova (1936). After successive critical plaudits with Love in Stunt Flying (1937), Nuits de Vienne (1939) and Das Fräulein von Barnhelm (1940), Fita had become firmly established as one of Germany's leading comediennes. She continued her career with some success after the war, gradually drifting into character roles, notably as Mother Wolff in Gerhart Hauptmann's The Beaver Coat (1949). After the death of her husband in 1957, she went into quasi-retirement. In the year of her death, 1967, her contribution was deservedly recognised with a Bambi Award.
biography.name: Fita Benkhoff

biography.bio: Ilse Steppat was born on November 30, 1917 in Barmen, Germany as Ilse Paula Steppat. She was an actress, known for On Her Majesty's Secret Service (1969), Marriage in the Shadows (1947) and Confessions of Felix Krull (1957). She was married to Max Nosseck. She died on December 21, 1969 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Ilse Steppat

biography.bio: Ingeborg Schöner was born on July 2, 1935 in Wiesbaden, Hesse, Germany. She is an actress, known for Soko, brigade des stups (1978), Buen Día, Ramón (2013) and The Cow and I (1959). She was previously married to Georg Marischka.
biography.name: Ingeborg Schöner

biography.bio: Fritz Wagner was born on March 19, 1915 in Heilbronn, Baden-Württemberg, Germany. He was an actor, known for The Bridge (1949), Film Without a Name (1948) and Freies Land (1946). He died on January 19, 1982 in Bonn, North Rhine-Westphalia, West Germany.
biography.name: Fritz Wagner

biography.bio: Bruno Fritz was born on March 4, 1900 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor, known for Ein Mann für Jenny (1956), Familie Musici (1968) and Die Ballade vom Cowboy (1969). He died on June 12, 1984 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Bruno Fritz

biography.bio: Günter Pfitzmann was born on April 8, 1924 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor, known for Praxis Bülowbogen (1987), Drei Damen vom Grill (1977) and Gestatten - Mein Name ist Cox (1961). He was married to Liselotte Giebken and Karin Hübner. He died on May 30, 2003 in Berlin.
biography.name: Günter Pfitzmann

biography.bio: Wolfgang Müller was born on December 14, 1922 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor, known for The Captain from Köpenick (1956), Roses for the Prosecutor (1959) and Als geheilt entlassen (1960). He died on April 26, 1960 in Lostallo, Graubünden, Switzerland.
biography.name: Wolfgang Müller

biography.bio: Ernst Stahl-Nachbaur was born on March 6, 1886 in Munich, Germany. He was an actor and director, known for M (1931), Murderers Among Us (1946) and Boycott (1930). He was married to Carola Toelle. He died on May 13, 1960 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Ernst Stahl-Nachbaur

biography.placeOfBirth: Königsberg, East Prussia, Germany [now Kaliningrad, Russia]
biography.bio: Clemens Hasse was born on April 13, 1908 in Königsberg, East Prussia, Germany. He was an actor, known for Ce diable de garçon (1944), Sept dans un lycée (1935) and Deadly Decision (1954). He was married to Ursula Diestel. He died on July 28, 1959 in New York City, New York, USA.
biography.name: Clemens Hasse

biography.bio: Wolfgang Gruner was born on September 20, 1926 in Rathenow, Germany. He was an actor and writer, known for Babylon 69 (1969), We Cellar Children (1960) and Ready, Willing and Able (1971). He was married to Eva. He died on March 16, 2002 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Wolfgang Gruner

biography.bio: Else Reval was born on June 14, 1893 in Berlin, Germany. She was an actress, known for Zwischenfall im Roxy (1954), Das Fenster im 2. Stock (1939) and Barbara, wo bist Du? (1939). She died on January 25, 1978 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Else Reval

biography.bio: Joseph Noerden was born in 1927 in Luxembourg. He was an actor, known for Corinna Schmidt (1951), Der Weg ist dunkel (1956) and Mitternacht (1957). He died on May 2, 1991 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Joseph Noerden

biography.bio: Ralf Wolter was born on November 26, 1926 in Berlin, Germany. He is an actor, known for Cabaret (1972), One, Two, Three (1961) and Winnetou: The Last Shot (1965). He has been married to Edith since 1959.
biography.name: Ralf Wolter
